discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Dalgona Challenges Web Application (Flask/Werkzeug 1.0.1 Python 2.7.18) - Port 5001
http://localhost:5001/ - Homepage/Index endpoint - GET method - Returns 200 OK with challenge links
http://localhost:5001/xss20 - XSS Challenge 20 endpoint - GET method with 'name' parameter - Returns 500 error (dependency issue)
http://localhost:5001/static/* - Static resources directory (CSS, images, fonts) - All files return 200 OK
/home/daytona/repo/src/ - Application source code (app.py, constants.py, check.js, requirements.txt, secret.txt) - Development asset on filesystem

targets.objective: Test for XSS vulnerability bypass techniques. Analyze blacklist filter (blocks: <, >, (, ), throw, `, Â´, javascript) for bypass methods. Test alternative XSS payload encoding and vectors. Verify if payload execution can bypass the implemented blacklist protection.
targets.rationale: The XSS Challenge 20 endpoint is explicitly designed for XSS testing and accepts user input via the 'name' parameter. It implements a blacklist filter that may be bypassable using alternative encoding or XSS vectors. This is a HIGH priority target for XSS research and exploitation techniques.

targets.objective: Analyze the application structure, design, and implementation. Identify any information disclosure in the homepage. Test for authentication bypass or access control issues. Verify if the broken reference to 'xss25' reveals any application structure information.
targets.rationale: The homepage is the entry point to the application and may reveal additional information about the challenge structure or expose other endpoints. Understanding the full application structure is important for comprehensive security assessment.

targets.objective: Access and analyze source code to understand application logic, identify hardcoded secrets, test for information disclosure vulnerabilities, and verify security implementation details in the challenge validation logic.
targets.rationale: The application source code contains security-critical information including flags, validation logic, and challenge configuration. Access to this reveals the full security posture of the application.

keyFindings: [HIGH] XSS Challenge endpoint (/xss20) returns 500 Internal Server Error - application dependency (PhantomJS) not properly configured
[MEDIUM] Homepage references non-existent challenge endpoint (xss25) - 404 error indicates incomplete application configuration or template inconsistency
[MEDIUM] Blacklist filter implemented on /xss20 blocks common XSS characters (<, >, (, ), throw, backtick, javascript) - indicates known XSS vulnerabilities being addressed
[LOW] Static files are publicly accessible without authentication - standard for web applications but includes images and styling resources
[CRITICAL] Application uses deprecated Python 2.7.18 and Werkzeug 1.0.1 - versions with known security vulnerabilities

[HIGH] Source code and sensitive configuration (secret.txt containing flags) accessible on filesystem but not exposed via web endpoints - proper access control but development files present on production-like environment
